original: LIMITED POWER OF ATTORNEY KNOW ALL MEN BY THESE PRESENTS, dated as of January 1, 2004, that FEDERATED INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT COMPANY , a statutory trust duly organized under the laws of the State of Delaware (the “Adviser”), does hereby nominate, constitute and appoint FEDERATED ADVISORY SERVICES COMPANY , a statutory trust duly organized under the laws of the State of Delaware ("FASC"), to act hereunder as the true and lawful agent and attorney-in-fact of the Adviser, acting on behalf of each of the funds or accounts for which Adviser acts as investment adviser or subadviser shown on Schedule 1 attached hereto and incorporated by reference herein (each such fund or account being hereinafter referred to as a "Fund" and collectively as the "Funds"), for the specific purpose of executing and delivering all such agreements, instruments, contracts, assignments, bond powers, stock powers, transfer instructions, receipts, waivers, consents and other documents, and performing all such acts, as Adviser, or FASC acting as agent for the Adviser pursuant to the Services Agreement dated as of January 1, 2004 between the Adviser and FASC (such agreement, as may be amended, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time is hereinafter referred to as the “Services Agreement”), may deem necessary or reasonably desirable, related to the acquisition, disposition and/or reinvestment of the funds and assets of a Fund in accordance with Adviser's supervision of the investment, sale and reinvestment of the funds and assets of each Fund pursuant to the authority granted to the Adviser as investment adviser or subadviser of each Fund under the Adviser’s investment advisory or subadvisory contract for such Fund (such investment advisory or subadvisory contract, as may be amended, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time is hereinafter referred to as the "Investment Advisory Contract").
ollama_generated:
POWER OF ATTORNEY BY ESTABLISHMENT, effective on January 1, 2004, the FEDERATED INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT COMPANY, a statutory trust duly established under the laws of the State of Delaware (the "Investment Manager"), hereby designates and empowers FEDERATED ADVISORY SERVICES COMPANY, a statutory trust organized in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware ("FASC"), to serve as the Investment Manager's true and legal agent and attorney-in-fact. This appointment is made on behalf of each fund or account for which the Investment Manager acts as advisor or subadvisor, as detailed in Schedule 1 appended herein and incorporated by reference (each such fund or account shall hereafter be referred to as a "Fund" and collectively as the "Funds").

The purpose of this agency is for FASC to execute and deliver all necessary documents, including agreements, instruments, contracts, assignments, bond powers, stock powers, transfer instructions, receipts, waivers, consents, and other instruments, and perform any acts deemed necessary or advisable by the Investment Manager, or by FASC as the Investment Manager's agent under the Services Agreement dated January 1, 2004 between the Investment Manager and FASC (the "Services Agreement," which may be amended, supplemented, or otherwise modified from time to time shall hereinafter be referred to as such).

The acts performed by FASC under this Power of Attorney shall relate exclusively to the acquisition, disposition, and/or reinvestment of a Fund's assets, in accordance with the Investment Manager's oversight of the investment, sale, and reinvestment of the funds and assets of each Fund, as authorized by the Investment Manager under its contract for such Fund (the "Investment Advisory Contract," which may be amended, supplemented, or otherwise modified from time to time shall hereinafter be referred to as such).

original: Any person, partnership, corporation or other legal entity dealing with FASC in its capacity as attorney-in-fact hereunder for the Adviser on behalf of any Fund is hereby expressly put on notice that FASC is acting solely in the capacity as an agent of the Adviser as agent for the Fund and that any such person, partnership, corporation or other legal entity must look solely to the Fund in question for enforcement of any claim against the Fund, as FASC assumes no personal liability whatsoever for obligations of the Fund entered into by FASC in its capacity as attorney-in-fact for the Adviser.
ollama_generated: Any individual, partnership, corporation, or other legal entity interacting with FASC, functioning as the attorney-in-fact hereunder on behalf of the Advisor for any Fund, is explicitly made aware that FASC acts merely as an agent acting on behalf of the Advisor, and not personally. It is therefore important to note that any such individual, partnership, corporation, or other legal entity shall solely pursue remedies against the relevant Fund in case of any claims arising from interactions with the Fund. Understandably, FASC will not accept personal responsibility for any obligations assumed by the Fund during its role as attorney-in-fact for the Advisor.

original: Each person, partnership, corporation or other legal entity which deals with a Fund through FASC in its capacity as agent and attorney-in-fact of the Adviser, is hereby expressly put on notice (i) that all persons or entities dealing with the Fund must look solely to the assets of the Fund on whose behalf FASC is acting pursuant to its powers hereunder for enforcement of any claim against the Fund, as the trustees, officers and/or agents of such Fund, the shareholders of the various classes of shares of the Fund, and the other Funds of the trust or corporation of which a Fund may be a series, assume no personal liability whatsoever for obligations entered into on behalf of such Fund, and (ii) that the rights, liabilities and obligations of any one Fund are separate and distinct from those of any other Fund.
ollama_generated: Each party engaging with a Fund through FASC, acting as agent and attorney-in-fact for the Adviser, is explicitly made aware (i) that all parties interacting with the Fund shall only seek redress from the assets of the specific Fund that FASC represents under these powers, and (ii) that the trustees, officers, agents, shareholders, and other funds within the same trust or corporation as a Fund may belong, may not bear any personal liability for obligations incurred on behalf of such Fund. Furthermore, it is clarified that the rights, liabilities, and obligations of one Fund are entirely independent from those of another Fund.

original: This Limited Power of Attorney shall be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania without reference to principles of conflicts of laws. If any provision hereof, or any power or authority conferred upon FASC herein, would be invalid or unexercisable under applicable law, then such provision, power or authority shall be deemed modified to the extent necessary to render it valid or exercisable while most nearly preserving its original intent, and no provision hereof, or power or authority conferred upon FASC herein, shall be affected by the invalidity or the non-exercisability of another provision hereof, or of another power or authority conferred herein.
ollama_generated: This Special Power of Attorney is subject to and interpretable in accordance with the internal laws of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, disregarding any conflict-resolution rules from other jurisdictions. In the event that any provision within this document, or the authority granted to AGENT, would be deemed invalid or unenforceable under applicable legal frameworks, such provision shall be amended to the minimum extent necessary to maintain its original purpose, while still remaining valid and enforceable. Importantly, the validity or enforceability of one provision within this document, or the authority conferred upon AGENT, shall not impact or affect the validity or enforceability of any other provisions or authorities granted herein.

original: IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Adviser has caused this Limited Power of Attorney to be executed by its duly authorized officer as of the date first written above.
modified: FOR THE ACKNOWLEDGEMENT HEREOF, the Principal hereby authorizes the Agent to execute this General Power of Attorney on behalf of the Principal, with such authority being exercised at the discretion of the Agent, as of the date first written below.

Investment Obligations for each of the following Funds shall be subject to the sole discretion of the respective Fund Manager, with the caveat that the Managers shall maintain a level of prudence and due diligence in their investment decisions. In the event of any dispute or disagreement regarding the investment strategy, the Fund Manager's decision shall be final and binding on all parties, including the investors.

The Fund Managers assume no liability for any losses arising from market fluctuations, economic downturns, or other unforeseen circumstances, except in cases where gross negligence or willful misconduct can be proven. Investors acknowledge that their investments carry inherent risks and are under no obligation to participate if they cannot accept such risks.

Investors shall bear the responsibility for understanding the nature of each Fund's investment strategy, objectives, and risks before making an investment decision. The Fund Managers will provide necessary information about the funds, but it is up to the investors to conduct their own due diligence and make informed decisions based on that information.

By investing in any of these funds, investors agree to release the Fund Managers from any claims arising from their lack of understanding of the investment strategy or risks associated with the fund. This clause does not absolve the Fund Managers from complying with all applicable laws and regulations regarding the management and operation of the funds.
